title: The Bachelor stars Matty J and Laura Byrne jet 25 hours to take newborn baby Marlie-Mae to London
text:
They're The Bachelor success story who welcomed their first child together in June.

And this week, Matty J and fiancée Laura Byrne shared images of their first overseas trip together as a trio - flying a whopping 25 hours from Australia to visit London.

The pair exclaimed their excitement at their 'first family holiday' on Instagram, where they shared a selection of snaps with their beautiful daughter, Marlie-Mae.

So happy! Matty J (left) and Laura Byrne (right) looked in high spirits as they posed up a storm in England's capital this week, for their first trip abroad as a family with their newborn daughter

Holding their little tot on a rainy London street, proud mother Laura, 33, wrote: 'Oh how things have changed... We have been smashing the tea and are in bed by 9:30. London you're a proper good time.'

In the snap, the doting parents were pictured beaming widely in full winter attire - while little Marlie-Mae wrapped up in a cute orange hat with matching dress.

Matty, 32, shared another snap of himself gripping onto his smiling tot, on a rooftop outside Trafalgar Square.

'25hrs later and we made it!' Matty J revealed the couple had travelled over a day with their three-month-old daughter in tow

'That smile is gonna be the end of me!' Matty J then posted a cute image of his little girl on his lap, during their first ever train journey together

'25hrs later and we made it!' he wrote.

After sharing an excitable video outside of Buckingham Palace, Matty then posted a cute image of his daughter sitting on his lap during their first train journey.

Alongside the snap - which featured Marlie-Mae sporting an adorable fluffy lamb jumper complete with ears - he wrote: 'That smile is gonna be the end of me!'

London lady! Laura looked absolutely sensational as she strutted her stuff in England, despite having gone through a stressful flight with the pair's baby daughter

Happy family! Despite the classic English weather, the genetically-blessed family appeared in high spirits as they posed for photos down an old cobbled street

Last month, Laura told WHO magazine that the loved-up pair 'definitely' want more children.

They however admitted they aren't in a rush to expand their family until after their wedding next year.

'We keep saying we definitely want to have more than one baby. I'm not rushing into doing it tomorrow, but we would love another kid,' she told the magazine.

The pair's love story famously began when Matty chose Laura as the winner of The Bachelor back in 2017.

They confirmed their engagement in April this year.
description: They're The Bachelor success story who welcomed their first child together in June.
authors: Nicole Douglas For Daily Mail Australia
